name: market for bark | bark | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/13223/documentation

This is a market activity, representing a treatment mix. In the case of products needing treatment, market mixes are supplied by the activities treating the product in the geography defined by the market, and they supply the activities needing to treat the product, as they have generated it as a by-product in the Undefined processes (present as a negative input in system models). Transport to the treating facility or losses are also accounted in this type of markets, when relevant.;This is the market for  'bark', in the Global geography.;It is considered that bark is an intermediate product, that is always treated in the same place where it is produced, the sawing mill, normally by chipping it into bark chips, so no transport is added to this market.;The product 'bark' represents the outer layer of logs. The weight is expressed as dry mass. Bark is produced as a by-product during the sawing of hardwood and softwood in the sawmill. In the sawmill, bark is further chopped into bark chips. 

With the production of bark in the sawing mill.

With the bark taken care within the same facility.
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/161:Sawmilling and planing of wood/1610:Sawmilling and planing of wood
